titleInfo.title: Lloyd's Steamboat Directory and Disasters on the Western Waters

mods.abstract: In 1856 Lloyd's Steamboat Directory and Disasters on the Western Waters details more than a hundred steamboat disasters, including explosions, collisions, sinkings, and capsizes. The illustration showing the explosion of the steamship Louisiana docked in New Orleans is shown.
mods.note: Early European explorers faced many challenges, including unfamiliar and sometimes dangerous flora and fauna, as well as the hostility of the human inhabitants whose homelands they sought to take for themselves. Under French government policy, the native population was soon decimated by systematic extermination and disease. Later settlers found diseases such as yellow fever and typhoid a threat during the summer months. Along with the multitude of natural hazards that new populations faced, sometimes transportation was a source of danger in itself.

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Book Collection

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained in accordance with U. S. copyright laws.
mods.note: LSU Special Collections Online, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
